newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Skoda chief dies in car crash-agency.
newsitem.headline: Czech Skoda chief dies in car crash-agency.

text.p: Ludvik Kalma, the chairman of Czech auto maker Skoda Auto a.s., was killed late on Sunday when his car crashed into an oncoming truck, the Czech news agency CTK reported on Monday.
CTK said Kalma's Skoda Octavia was hit by the truck as it passed through an intersection close to the southern Czech town of Tabor. The cause of the accident is under investigation, it added.
CTK did not say if there were any other people injured in the crash. Skoda officials were not immediately available for comment.
Kalma had been at the helm of the Czech car maker since April 1991.
Germany's Volkswagen AG, according to a privatisation agreement with the Czech goverment, increased its stake in Skoda to 70 percent last year from 60.3 percent.
